alert.note: Alert for East Slopes of the Washington Cascades (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 10 at 10:50AM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...MODERATE TO HEAVY RAIN WILL CONTINUE TO CAUSE RISES ON CREEKS AND STREAMS THROUGH THE WEEKEND... ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of central Washington and south central Washington, including the following areas, in central Washington, Yakima Valley. In south central Washington, East Slopes of the Washington Cascades. * WHEN...Through Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Bands of moderate to heavy showers expected to redevelop later this afternoon into Saturday morning. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes of the Washington Cascades
